list_definition.definition: the wheel or handle by which a ship is steered

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He asked me to take the helm (= steer the ship).

list_ex_of_english: Crystal spheres may contain multiple worlds and are navigable using ships equipped with spelljamming helms.
All medical and surgical wards were divided into units, each of which was helmed by its own specialist chief.
Helms called it the war we won.
There has been no change in regulation, although the use of traditional noble indicators (certain types of helms, and supporters, for example) is restricted.
Ships powered by spelljamming helms are capable of flying into not only the sky but into space.
They wound long bright scarfs around their helms to ward off sunstroke.
Changes in the distribution of political power, such as elections or a cabinet reshuffle with new ministers at the helm, open windows of opportunity.
He continued to regularly direct episodes throughout the series run and has helmed a total of 41 episodes as of the close of the fourteenth season.
